SourceString: On a Strange Shore
I should find out where the Fates have delivered me.
I made it to Pyrgos, a village besieged by ichthians. The local god of the area, Glaukos, should be able to help me reach the Moirai--if I can find him.

My mentor Aristonoe is dead. The goddess Nemesis killed her, then pursued me across the sea. I would have drowned, if not for the charm my mentor gave me. I have no idea where I am, or how to find the Moirai as Aristonoe wished.

I\'ve washed ashore, but I\'m not alone. Aristonoe\'s charm contains the spirit of the divine horse, Areion. He is friends with the god Glaukos, who can help me reach the Moirai temple. Perhaps the gods are smiling on me after all.
Find a god to help reach the Moirai
Glaukos can help you
Explore the beach
Follow the voice
Save Areion from the crabs
Follow the road
Go through the cave
Continue on the road
Defeat the ichthians
Destroy the bridge
Travel to Pyrgos village with Philon
Defeat the ichthians at Glaukos\'s shrine
Speak to Philon
Enter Pyrgos village
A voice called out to me from the charm Aristonoe gave me. It must have washed ashore nearby. I should look for it.
I should look for a village, so I can find out how to reach the Moirai temple.
Along the main road, I found a stranger being attacked by ichthians. Perhaps he can help me find the Moirai.
Areion believes the god Glaukos can help us reach the Moirai. I should continue on to Pyrgos village and seek Glaukos\'s temple.
The Town on the Hill
Find a way through Pyrgos to search for Glaukos
I joined the Pyrgos militia and was given access to the elevator
The elevator from Pyrgos to the farmlands below is off-limits to all but the militia due to the ichthian threat. If I\'m to search for Glaukos, I must join the militia.
I proved myself to Lochagos Rizon and joined the Pyrgos militia.
Find a path forward through Pyrgos
Find a way to access the elevator out of Pyrgos
Speak to Lochagos Rizon about joining the militia
Defeat the ichthian brute
Speak to Lochagos Rizon
Join the militia to access the flooded farmlands
No one can take the elevator out of Pyrgos unless they\'re part of the militia. I should see about joining the militia, so I can search for Glaukos.
The elevator from Pyrgos to the farmlands below is off-limits to all but the militia due to theichthian threat. If I\'m to [continue my search], I must join the militia.
Ancient Embers
Find a use for Embers of Night
I traded Embers of Night with Ianthe for rewards
I found Embers of Night, strange clusters of magic pulsing with dark energy. They seem valuable, perhaps someone in Pyrgos would be interested in them.
I found an old woman named Ianthe who is researching the Mycenaeans. She gave me rewards in exchange for Embers of Night.
Find someone with knowledge of Embers of Night
Collect 1 Ember of Night
Return to Ianthe with 1 Ember of Night
Collect 30 Embers of Night
Return to Ianthe with the first batch of Embers of Night
Collect 30 Embers of Night
Return to Ianthe with the second batch of Embers of Night
Collect 30 Embers of Night
Return to Ianthe with the third batch of Embers of Night
Collect 30 Embers of Night
Return to Ianthe with the fourth batch of Embers of Night
Collect 30 Embers of Night
Return to Ianthe with the fifth batch of Embers of Night
Collect 30 Embers of Night
Return to Ianthe with the sixth batch of Embers of Night
Collect 30 Embers of Night
Return to Ianthe with the seventh batch of Embers of Night
The Search for the Sea-God
I should go to the temple of Glaukos to seek the god\'s help reaching the Moirai temple.
It appears the god Glaukos has abandoned the region.
I need to speak to the Moirai about why Nemesis is hunting me, but only a god can get me to them. Areion believes his old friend, the god Glaukos, can help, so I search for Glaukos at his temple.

The temple of Glaukos was in a terrible state. The ichthians unearthed Titan Ichor inside the temple\'s crypt and were trying to sacrifice the priestess of Glaukos to it. I absorbed the ichor and freed the priestess, but she was unable to call on Glaukos. It seems the god truly has gone missing. I must find another way to reach the Moirai.
Go to Glaukos\'s temple
Speak to Philon
Search for the captives
Free the prisoner
Enter the crypt
Find the priestess
Touch the Titan Ichor
Defeat the enemies
Check on the priestess
Touch the Titan Ichor
Leave the crypt
Speak to the priestess
The ichthians have overrun the temple and taken captives. I should find and free them.
Ichthians captured the priestess of Glaukos. I should free her.
I freed the priestess. She will call on Glaukos for me. I should meet her back in the temple.
Whispers of the Moirai
Speak to the Moirai
I spoke to the Moirai
Aristonoe told me that my only hope of surviving against Nemesis was to consult the Fates. It\'s time to meet them.
I consulted the Fates, and they gave me a prophecy as well as a special dye phial that will allow me to absorb Nemesis\'s energy.
Meet Glaukos in the northern mountain range
Enter the Moirai Temple
Find a way through the temple
Kill all of Nemesis\' harbingers
Inspect the statue
Investigate Nemesis\'s troops in the temple
Find a way to the depths of the temple
Look for another way through the temple
Inspect the glowing statue
Follow the path through the cave
Follow the guidance of the Moirai
Leave the cave passage
Defeat Nemesis\'s harbingers
Approach the Titan Ichor
Touch the Titan Ichor
Complete the Divine Challenge
Absorb the Divine Energy
Activate the statue
Leave the temple dungeon
Find a way through the temple
Defeat the fallen champion
Enter the portal
Talk to the Moirai
Take the Dye Phial
The Wild God
I should seek the god Pan\'s help in his vineyard

I still need a god\'s help to reach the Moirai temple, so that I can learn the prophecy that has caused Nemesis to hunt me. Glaukos has abandoned the region, but the god Pan dwells in a vineyard in the north. Perhaps he can help me?

The old man Philon was Glaukos in disguise this entire time! He has agreed to help me enter the Moirai Temple. Pan proved a trickster, who tried to trap and kill me, but I fought him off. I don\'t think I\'ve seen the last of him, though.
Enter Pan\'s vineyard
Ask Pan for help reaching the Moirai
Enter Pan\'s Cave
Complete the ritual in the Cave of Pan
Destroy the ritual brazier
Leave the cave and meet Pan at his hilltop shrine
Defeat Pan
Talk to Pan
Talk to Glaukos
Pan attacked me! I must defeat him.
I defeated Pan. Will he help me reach the Moirai now?
The Crabs\' Nest
I should destroy the crabs\' nest so the ichthians can\'t breed any more crabs
I destroyed the crabs\' nest and reported to Pentekonter Linus
The ichthians are breeding crabs in the flooded fields. The beasts are a menace, and will soon overwhelm the farmlands if I don\'t do something.
The crabs\' nest is destroyed, and the enclave quartermaster was able to use a piece of crab shell to help fortify the enclave\'s defenders.
Locate the crabs\' nest
Destroy the large cluster of crab eggs
Kill the Mother Crab
Pick up the crab trophy
Report the destruction of the crabs\' nest
Bring the shell to Pentekonter Linus
Talk to the quartermaster
I found a piece of crab shell. It\'s sturdy. I wonder if someone at the enclave might have a use for it?
Defend the Enclave
I should support the enclave\'s defenders wherever I can.
The enclave is secure. For now.
The situation at the refugee enclave in the middle of the farmlands is precarious. Ichthians are attacking from the southern gates, and the militia is struggling to hold them off.
I helped the militia defend the enclave\'s southern gates, buying them time to improve their defenses and catch their breath.
Defend the southeast gate
The southeast gate is clear. Report to Pentekonter Linus
Defend the southwest gate
The southwest gate is clear. Report to Pentekonter Linus
The Gorgon Snake
Save Issa
I slew the Gorgon snake and saved Issa
Issa was bitten by a Gorgon snake and is slowly turning to stone! Lalage said that she thinks brewing a cure from its blood might work.
Issa was bitten by a Gorgon snake and began turning to stone. I managed to find and slay the snake, then Lalage brewed a cure from its blood.
Talk to Lalage
Find the Gorgon snake
Kill the Gorgon snake and acquire its blood
Bring the snake blood to Lalage
Give Issa the snakebite cure
The Shattered God
Reassemble the statue of Glaukos
I found all the statue pieces and reassembled it
A statue of Glaukos was broken into pieces in the flooding. If I find all the pieces and reassemble them at the statue base, the locals would probably appreciate it.
I reassembled the statue of Glaukos in an effort to return hope to the local people despairing over the absence of their god.
Collect the head
Collect the tail
Collect the torso
Collect the staff
Bring the statue pieces to the statue base
Find where the statue base is
Burial Rites
I should find out why the dead are rising and put them to rest.
I put the ghosts of the hero Aristomenes and his battle companions to rest.

The people of the Pyrgos region can\'t bury their dead following the ichthian attack because the flooding damaged the graveyard and interrupted the burial rites. The grave keeper Nephele needs my help to put the undead to rest.

The ancient hero Aristomenes had returned from the dead, believing it was his responsibility to defend Pyrgos from the ichthians once more. Poor, confused soul. I put him and his companions to rest. The grave keeper should be able to put the remaining dead to rest now.
Talk to the graveyard guard
Find Grave Keeper Nephele
Meet Nephele at the inner gate
Use the incense at the tomb of Aristomenes
Find a way to access the tomb of Aristomenes
Put Hyllus to rest
Put Otonia to rest
Put Tydeus to rest
Defeat Aristomenes and put him to rest
I should put the ancient heroes who are stirring up the dead to rest.
Headhunt
I should take out any ichthian commanders I find and report to Lochagos Rizon
I killed all four ichthian commanders.
I found a tough ichthian that dropped a \"commander medallion\". Lochagos Rizon will no doubt be happy to see it, and pleased if I take out any other commanders.
I wiped out the ichthian leadership in the area and brought Lochagos Rizon commander medallions as proof.
Kill the ichthian commander in the east
Kill the ichthian commander in the south
Kill the ichthian commander in the west
Kill the ichthian commander in the north
Report to Lochagos Rizon
Bring Lochagos Rizon four ichthian commander medallions
Four ichthian commanders are scattered around the flooded farmlands. Killing them will support the militia heavily.
The Trickster\'s Shrine
Receive a blessing from the shrine
I received a blessing from the Shrine of Hermes

I repaired an old shrine, which revealed the following text: \"You who desire the blessing of Hermes / God of travellers, messengers, cunning and trade / Bring here the beast from which Hermes crafted the first lyre / And sacrifice it before the altar, spilling its blood on this ground.\"
I fulfilled the shrine\'s requirements, sacrificing a turtle to it and gaining a blessing.
Do what the shrine\'s inscription asks
Missing Cows
Resolve the conflict between Stolos and the enclave\'s refugees
I resolved the conflict between Stolos and the enclave\'s refugees
Stolos, the farmer who owns the enclave\'s land, is upset with the refugees and refusing to share his food with them. Issa, the leader of the refugees, needs help resolving the situation.

It turns out that Stolos was angry at the refugees from Pyrgos for a good reason--thirty years ago the people of Pyrgos refused to help save his wife. Issa apologized on behalf of the town, and Stolos agreed to share his food.
Talk to Issa
Find the cows
Lead the cows home to Stolos
Talk to Stolos and Issa
Talk to Lalage
Seek out Old Man Thon
Talk to Old Man Thon
Return to Lalage and Issa
Bring the potion to Stolos
Heroic Spirit
Aid Kaenas
I helped Kaenas defeat an ichthian attack and get his sword back
I was told about Kaenas, a warrior of Pyrgos who went missing at the secluded beach up north.
I met a friendly spirit named Kaenas, and we defeated an ichthian assault together. Kaenas\'s sword had been stolen by an ichthian, so I found it for him, but he asked me to keep it.
Find Kaenas
Join the friendly spirit in battle
Defeat the ichthians with Kaenas
Speak to Kaenas
Find Kaenas\'s sword
Return Kaenas\'s sword to him
I came upon a friendly spirit named Kaenas fighting ichthians at a beach. He called for me to join him in battle.
Wings and Fangs
End the minyade attacks
I ended the noise that was bothering the minyades
Bat-like monsters called minyades have been attacking people near Pyrgos and need to be dealt with.
I discovered that the minyades were being riled up by some noisy ichthians. I killed the ichthians and made peace with the minyades.
Find out what agitated the Minyades
Find the reason for the minyade attacks
Kill the noisy ichthians
Talk to the Minyade leader
Talk to Otus
Smoke Over Pyrgos
Stop the enemy smoke signals at Lookout\'s Vantage
I helped the militia destroy the smoke signals.
A group of militia soldiers has been tasked with stopping ichthian smoke signals that are being used to signal attacks on Pyrgos. They need my help.
I helped the militia claim Lookout\'s Vantage and stop the smoke signals the ichthians were using to coordinate attacks on Pyrgos.
Help the militia destroy the smoke signals.
Help the militia fend off the ichthians
Claim the hill
Disable the smoke signal
Defeat the counterattack
Talk to Nireus
Report to Pentekonter Chryse
The Naiad and the Goats
I should find a way to speak to the naiad.
I spoke to the naiad and freed her goats.

I found a naiad surrounded by a herd of goats. But when I approached her grove, she turned me into a goat as well. I was lucky to escape. Areion believes moly root could help counter the naiad\'s transformation magic. It grows most commonly near temples and shrines.

Human selfishness knows no limits. A bandit robbed the Naiad of her precious lily, causing her to take revenge on others by turning them into goats. I was able to return the lily, and the naiad freed her captives.
Collect moly root
Use the moly root and talk to the naiad
Find the Lily
Return the sacred lily
I should find and return the naiad\'s sacred lily.
A naiad has transformed a group of farmers into goats because her sacred lily was stolen from her.
Cages in the Dark
Rescue the prisoners.
I rescued the prisoners from ichthian captivity.
Local villagers have been imprisoned by ichthians in a cave. If they\'re not rescued, who knows what awful fate the ichthians have in store for them?
I freed the prisoners from the cages the ichthians kept them in, and ensured they made it to safety.
Help the prisoners escape the cave
Ensure the prisoners made it out safely
Part of the Pride
Find Onetas
I killed Onetas and rescued the people he kidnapped
I came upon a camp of a group called the Bronze Lions, who seem interested in recruiting me. They told me to speak to their leader, Onetas.
A camp of bandits calling themselves the Bronze Lions tried to recruit me, but I realized that they\'re forcefully conscripting local people, so I put an end to them.
Find and speak to Onetas
Kill Onetas
Check Alastor and Boros made it out safely
End the Bronze Lion threat
The Stone Poet
Investigate the mystery of the Erana Ruins.
I defeated the hippokampos statue.
I discovered some mysterious ruins and encountered a strange yet friendly voice beckoning me closer.
A magical hippokampos statue lured me closer with the promise of a friendly poem recital, but it was a trap! I defeated her, putting an end to her evil.
Find the source of the mysterious voice
Talk to the magical hippokampos statue
Kill the hippokampos\'s summoned crabs
Defeat the hippokampos
The Hippokampos is evil and needs to be dealt with.
Fate Remembered
Relive a memory of combat with a powerful defeated foe.
I relived a memory of combat with a powerful foe.
After defeating a powerful enemy, I’ve acquired a Remnant they left behind. If I perform the correct ritual, perhaps I can find a way to relive a memory of the fight.
By performing a ritual with a Remnant, I relived a memory of combat with a powerful foe.
Go to a ritual shrine and unlock a memory of combat using a Remnant.
Relive a memory of combat with a powerful foe.
